result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan T Moris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Release for standard conditions.  Straight time if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No contact with any co-defendant except his brother.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ryan T Moris in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #4.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #4.  Count #5 is dismissed and read in.  Restitution has been paid.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Perkins makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #4

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - *** days).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with any co defendant except his brother.
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of  illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
	
Perform 40 hours of community service

COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
